spell.name: Acid Spit
entries: The caster spits a concentrated ball of acid at a target within range. The acid deals {@damage 4d6} acid damage on a hit and splashes onto adjacent creatures, who must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take half damage; on a success, they take no damage. Additionally, affected targets have disadvantage on their next attack roll due to the corrosive effect of the acid.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell level above 3rd.

spell.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: Tap into a surge of adrenaline that enhances your physical capabilities. For the duration, you gain +10 to movement speed, advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws, and +2 to melee and ranged weapon attack rolls. This surge of energy also grants temporary hit points equal to twice your spellcasting modifier at the start of each turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, add an additional +5 movement speed and +1 to weapon attack rolls for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Age
entries: You establish a psionic link to a living creature within range, siphoning their life force to reverse your own aging. Choose a creature within range that must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save:
The target ages by 10 years, with the physical and mental consequences as determined by the DM.
You de-age by 2 years, undoing the effects of prior aging, though it cannot reduce your age below your starting point.
Aftereffects:
The target suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
If the target ages more than their species' expected lifespan, they immediately suffer disadvantage on all Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution checks for 24 hours due to debilitating fatigue.
Using this ability in the presence of allies or neutral creatures may reduce their trust in you, as it is considered a hostile and deeply unsettling action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a psionic slot of 3rd level or higher:
Target’s aging increases by 5 years per level above 2nd.
Your de-aging increases by 1 year per level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aggressive Heat Dump
entries: You channel all your neural heat into a single target within range, causing their body to violently explode. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).

On a failed save: The target takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and each creature within a 20-foot radius of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 3d10} psychic damage, or half as much on a successful save.
On a successful save: The target takes half damage and does not explode; creatures within the radius take half damage as well.
Area of Effect:
The explosion creates a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the original target.
Psychic Sensitivity:
If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw, and if they fail, they take an additional {@damage 2d10} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
4th level: The psychic damage to the target increases to {@dice 8d10} and the area of effect radius increases to 30 feet.
5th level: You can restore an additional expended spell slot (up to a maximum of 4th level).

spell.name: Animal Allies

components.m: (a small piece of food that is attractive to animals)

entries: You summon the natural spirits of the land to call upon nearby animals for aid. Upon casting this spell, animals within a 300-foot radius that are not hostile toward you are drawn to your location. These creatures will arrive and remain for the duration of the spell, ready to assist you.
Effects:

Companionship: You gain the temporary services of {@dice 1d4 + 1} animals of your choice from the surrounding environment, such as birds, wolves, or even larger beasts. The exact type and number of animals are at the DM's discretion.

Shared Awareness: While the animals are within 60 feet of you, you can communicate with them telepathically and share simple commands. They will act on your behalf to defend you or assist in non-combat tasks, such as scouting or gathering information.
Bonding: The animals gain a bonus to their attack rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier and can make an additional attack as a bonus action if you command them to attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, you can summon an additional {@dice 1d4} animals for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Assassinate
entries: You become one with the shadows, enhancing your deadly intent. If you are hidden from a creature and you make a weapon attack against it, the attack is made with advantage. If you hit, it is considered a critical hit.

Additionally, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a failed save, they also take an additional {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage.
Note: The creature is aware of your presence if you are not hidden.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the additional necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Ball Lightning
entries: You create a sphere of crackling electricity that hovers in the air.
Effect: Choose a point within range. A ball of lightning forms in a 5-foot radius sphere at that point. The sphere lasts for the duration and emits dim light in a 10-foot radius.
At the start of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of the sphere takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage. The sphere can be moved up to 15 feet as a bonus action on your turn.
If a creature starts its turn within the sphere or enters it for the first time, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take the damage.
The sphere can also be dispelled if it enters an area with heavy rain or water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Barrier Of Denial
entries: Create a shimmering barrier that prevents creatures from passing through a designated area. Creatures that attempt to enter must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be unable to cross the barrier.

spell.name: Beckon
entries: Command a target enemy within range to approach you, compelling them with an irresistible urge. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failure, they are forced to move directly toward you on their turn by the fastest route available, using their full movement if necessary. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If they reach you, they are dazed for one round, giving you advantage on your next attack against them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range extends by 15 feet per level above 4th. Additionally, each level beyond 4th increases the duration of the dazed effect by one round.

spell.name: Bend Probability
entries: You manipulate the forces of chance around you. For the duration, you can add a {@dice d4} to any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check you make. You can use this effect after rolling but before the outcome is determined.

Additionally, while you maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell, you can also choose one creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from their next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus or penalty increases by 1 (for a total of a {@dice d6} for a 4th-level slot, a {@dice d8} for a 5th-level slot, etc.).

spell.name: Berserk Pulse
entries: You unleash a wave of chaotic psychic energy at a point you can see within range, inducing a surge of uncontrollable rage in all creatures within a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).

On a failed save: Affected creatures are considered {@condition frightened} for 1 minute and must use their action to attack the nearest creature (friend or foe) on their turns. At the end of each of their turns, they can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
On a successful save: The creature is unaffected and can act normally.
Duration:
While affected, the target may still attack normally, but their mind is clouded with rage, making it difficult to distinguish friends from foes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
5th level: The radius of the effect increases to 30 feet, and the duration of the {@condition frightened} condition increases to {@dice 1d4} rounds.
5th level: The psychic damage dealt by affected creatures while enraged increases to {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Beserk
entries: Effect:
You induce a state of psychosis in one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target is confused and must use its action to attack the nearest creature on its turn for 1 round.
On a successful save: The target suffers no effects.
Psychic Sensitivity:
If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw. If they fail, they remain confused for {@dice 1d4} rounds instead of just 1 round.
Ending the Effect:
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
4th level: The duration increases to up to 3 rounds.
5th level: You can target one additional creature within 30 feet of the original target for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blade Focus
entries: Attune yourself to the rhythm of melee combat. For the duration, you gain advantage on melee attack rolls, and critical hits are achieved on a roll of 19 or 20. While under this effect, if you miss an attack, you can reroll it once per turn. However, taking ranged damage requires a {@status Concentration|XPHB} saving throw to maintain the focus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, critical hits occur on an additional 1 lower for each level above 2nd (e.g., 18-20 for a 3rd-level slot).

spell.name: Blinding Pulse
entries: You generate a disruptive pulse of psychic energy that affects the visual processing of creatures in a 10-foot radius sphere within range. All creatures within this area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, they are {@condition blinded} for the duration, unable to see anything within the area and suffering disadvantage on attack rolls.
While {@condition blinded}, affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.
Psychic Sensitivity: If any of the affected creatures are psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on this saving throw, and the effect lasts for 1 minute instead of 30 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
3rd level: The radius of the effect increases 15 feet.
4th level: The duration increases to 3 rounds.
5th level: You can target an additional creature within the radius for each level above 2nd, provided they are within range.

spell.name: Bliss
entries: You enter a brief meditative state and project calming energy toward a target creature within range. This spell induces a profound sense of peace, causing hostile creatures nearby to become friendly for the duration.
Target: One creature of your choice within range.
Saving Throw: The target can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effects of the spell.
On a failed save: The target is affected by the spell for its duration and feels an overwhelming sense of serenity. While under this effect:
The target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on spells or abilities.
Hostile creatures within 10 feet of the affected creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become friendly toward the affected creature for the duration.
On a successful save: The target is unaffected.
{@status Concentration|XPHB} and Effects:

While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you can maintain the calming aura, but if you take damage, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the spell ends for all affected targets.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Blizzard
entries: You unleash a ferocious blizzard in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured by snow and ice, and the temperature drops dramatically.
Creatures in the Area:

Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} cold damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}.
Environment Effects:

The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration of the spell. Additionally, any creature that starts its turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and is unable to dash until the start of its next turn.
Duration and {@status Concentration|XPHB}:
The blizzard lasts for up to 2 hours as long as you maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. You can end the spell early if you choose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bolt
entries: Channel a jolt of static electricity towards a target, dealing minor electrical damage and causing them to become momentarily {@condition stunned}. The shock scales with the caster's psychic sensitivity.
Damage: {@damage 1d6} electrical damage.
Effect: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Bramble Maze
entries: You create a twisting maze of thorny brambles and vines in an area within range. The maze covers a 20-foot radius and is difficult terrain. Any creature that moves through the maze must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage from the thorns. The maze lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as a bonus action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, the radius of the maze increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Breathe Flame
entries: You open a temporary skipgate from deep within an underground chemical reservoir, igniting a volatile stream of burning gas in a 30-foot cone extending from your mouth.
Creatures in the Area: Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage and catches on fire.
On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and does not catch on fire.
Catching Fire: Any creature ignited by this spell takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the flames are extinguished (requiring an action).
Flammable Objects: Any flammable objects or unattended items in the area ignite and burn until extinguished.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Breathe Ice
entries: You exhale a frigid blast of icy air in a 15-foot cone. All creatures in that area must make a Constitution saving throw.
On a failed save: A creature takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and is frozen in place until the end of its next turn.
On a successful save: A creature takes half damage and is not frozen.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Burden
entries: You target one creature you can see within range and suppress their motor activity with a wave of psychic energy. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target's speed is halved, and they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws for the duration.
On a successful save: The target suffers no effects.
Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw, and their speed is reduced to 0 for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
2nd level: The duration increases to 3 minutes.
3rd level: You can target one additional creature within 30 feet of the original target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Chain Bolt
entries: Release a bolt of static electricity that arcs between multiple targets. Choose up to three targets within range. The primary target takes damage, and if they fail a Dexterity saving throw, the bolt chains to the next target, and so on. Each subsequent target takes reduced damage.
Damage: {@damage 2d6} electrical damage to the primary target.
Damage to secondary targets: {@damage 1d6} electrical damage.
Effect: Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking full damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. Each additional target takes {@damage 1d6} damage if they fail their saving throw.

spell.name: Chaos Skip
entries: You open a chaotic skipgate that unpredictably relocates a creature or object within range. Choose one creature or object that you can see. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled through the skipgate, appearing in a random location within 30 feet of its original position.
The location is determined by rolling on the following table:
{@dice d6}	Location Description
1	Directly behind the caster
2	10 feet to the left of the target
3	10 feet to the right of the target
4	15 feet straight up
5	15 feet straight down
6	A random point within a 30-foot radius, determined by the DM
If the target is unwilling, it can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it remains in its original location and the spell fails.

This chaotic manipulation of space may leave creatures disoriented. Any creature within 10 feet of the target when it reappears must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Charge And Skewer
entries: The caster channels primal energy and charges forward, impaling an enemy with a piercing weapon. The caster must move at least 10 feet straight toward a target to execute this spell. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage and is knocked back 10 feet, landing {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not knocked back.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Chemfuel Nodes
entries: Skips small bits of chemfuel inside the target's skin, carefully covering them with a psychic barrier to avoid pain and organ rejection. When the target dies, the nodules will explode, causing a significant area effect damage. The change is permanent, making it a nefarious and dangerous alteration.
Damage: {@damage 2d6} fire damage in a 10-foot radius upon detonation.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Chunk Skip

components.m: (a small piece of stone or earth)

entries: You create a skipgate that allows you to teleport a small object or chunk of material from a location within range to another point you can see. Choose a solid object that weighs no more than 50 pounds and is no larger than a 5-foot cube. The object instantly travels through the skipgate and appears at a point you designate within range.

If the object is part of a larger structure (such as a wall or floor), a section of that material will be teleported, potentially leaving a gap in the original structure. This could cause the structure to become unstable or unsafe, at the DM’s discretion.
The sudden loss of mass in the original location may create a brief disturbance, potentially alerting nearby creatures to your actions.

spell.name: Claw Frenzy
entries: The caster's hands morph into vicious claws, enhancing their melee attacks. For the duration, the caster gains the ability to make two claw attacks as part of their action. Each claw attack deals {@damage 2d6} slashing damage. Additionally, on a hit, the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cold Zone
entries: You create a chilling area in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range. The area becomes heavily affected by cold, creating difficult terrain.

**Creatures that start their turn in the cold zone or enter it for the first time on a turn must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} cold damage and has its speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and suffers no additional effects.
Additional Effects:

End of Turn: As a bonus action on your turn, you can choose to cause a frosty wind to sweep through the zone, forcing all creatures within it to make another Constitution saving throw, taking an additional {@damage 2d6} cold damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Concentrated Light
entries: The caster focuses light into a concentrated beam that targets a creature or object within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}. The caster can maintain the {@status Concentration|XPHB} to keep the beam focused, allowing them to roll the damage again at the start of each of their turns for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Heat Pearls

components.m: (a small piece of iron and a drop of oil)

entries: You create a number of small, glowing spheres of heat energy, up to a number equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of one). These heat pearls can be thrown as a ranged attack, dealing {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a hit to a target within range. On a hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become burned, taking an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it or another creature uses an action to extinguish the flames.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Consume Bodies

components.m: (a small piece of bone from a recently deceased creature)

entries: You harness the life force of nearby corpses, drawing on their energy to restore your own vitality. Choose up to three corpses within range. For each corpse, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. If the corpses are humanoid, you regain an additional {@dice 1d8} hit points for each one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Controlled Frenzy
entries: You channel intense focus to strike with ferocious speed without sacrificing control. For the duration, you can make an additional melee attack on each of your turns. Each attack is carefully aimed, allowing you to maintain accuracy and precision, and each successful hit has a chance to push your target back 5 feet. Additionally, while under the effects of Controlled Frenzy, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you gain an additional +1 to each attack’s damage roll for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Corpse Talk

components.m: (a small piece of bone or a drop of blood)

entries: You call upon the spirits of the dead to communicate through the body of a corpse within range. Choose a corpse that has been dead for no longer than 10 days. You can ask it up to five questions, which it answers to the best of its ability, influenced by its memories and state of mind at the time of death. The corpse can only answer questions that pertain to facts it would have known in life.

The corpse remains animated for the duration of the spell, with a slight flicker of life in its eyes, but it cannot move or act independently. If the corpse has any lingering animosity toward the living, it may respond with hostility.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can animate an additional corpse for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Counterspell Field
entries: Surround yourself with a field that absorbs spell energy. When a creature within 30 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to absorb it, negating its effects and regaining a spell slot of equal or lesser level.

spell.name: Craft Psyring
entries: You channel your knowledge of technology and magic to craft a psyring, a device that enhances psychic abilities. Choose a willing creature you touch to imbue with the psyring. The psyring grants the target the ability to regain one additional spell slot of a level equal to or less than half the caster’s level (rounded up) once per long rest.
Additionally, while wearing the psyring, the target can add a bonus equal to your spellcasting ability modifier to one psychic-related check per turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can craft an additional psyring for every slot level above 4th, provided you have enough materials.

spell.name: Craft Timeskip
entries: With a precise burst of temporal manipulation, you advance the construction or crafting process of an item as if it had been worked on continuously by its creator. When you touch a partially completed item or project:
The item immediately advances to completion, assuming all necessary materials were already present.
The caster ages 3 years due to the effort of forcing time to move forward for the object.
Limitations:
This power cannot create magic items or enchantments. It can only accelerate the crafting of mundane items, like weapons, armor, tools, or structures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a 3rd-level or higher psionic slot:
The caster's aging is reduced by 1 year per level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crop Burst
entries: You unleash a surge of magical energy that causes all plants in a 15-foot radius around a point you choose within range to grow rapidly and bear fruit or flowers in an instant. This effect not only increases the yield of crops but also creates a burst of vibrant flora that can be used for healing or sustenance.

Creatures of your choice within the area can regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, you can create a small amount of food or herbal components useful for potions or other spellcasting.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Vision
entries: You tap into the shadows, granting yourself the ability to see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can see up to 60 feet in darkness, and your vision is in shades of gray. This spell doesn’t allow you to see through magical darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can choose one additional creature you can see within range to also gain the benefits of this spell for the duration.

spell.name: Darkness
entries: You create an area of magical darkness in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The darkness spreads around corners, and a creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness. Non-magical light, regardless of its source, can’t illuminate it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the darkness increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Death Shield

components.m: (a small amount of ash from a burned corpse)

entries: You shroud yourself in a protective barrier of negative energy drawn from the essence of death itself. For the duration, you gain resistance to necrotic damage, and any creature that hits you with a melee attack takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

Additionally, while under the effects of this spell, you can choose to absorb a portion of the energy from a nearby corpse (within 30 feet) as a reaction when you take damage. When you do so, you regain hit points equal to half the damage taken, and the corpse is consumed, turning to ash.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the necrotic damage dealt to attackers increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Decoy
entries: You create a shimmering illusory duplicate of yourself at a point within range. This decoy appears and acts like you but cannot cast spells or take any actions. The decoy lasts for the duration or until it is destroyed.

The decoy has an AC of 10 + your Dexterity modifier and hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. Any creature that makes an attack against the decoy must roll a {@dice d20} and add their modifiers. On a roll of 10 or higher, the attack successfully hits the decoy.
While the decoy exists, you can use your bonus action to move it up to 30 feet. You can end the spell early as a bonus action on your turn.
Additionally, when a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to make the decoy appear closer to the attacker, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create one additional decoy for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Denial Of Action
entries: Choose one creature within range; that creature cannot take actions or reactions until the end of its next turn. It may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect early.

spell.name: Destroy Eyes
entries: You focus your twisted energy on the eyes of a creature you can see within range, attempting to destroy their ability to perceive the world. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

Damage: On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d8} psychic damage, and its eyes are rendered useless. For 1 minute, the target is {@condition blinded} and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that rely on sight. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Side Effects:
The caster must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer a temporary effect of madness, reflecting the horrific nature of the spell and the agony of severing sight from another being.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Disabling Strike
entries: Channel a concentrated burst of energy to strike an enemy, attempting to incapacitate them. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d8} damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not {@condition incapacitated}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Drain Psyessence
entries: You target a downed psychic-adept creature within range. As you channel intense psychic energy, you induce a horrific process of psychic noise that liquefies the target's flesh, converting it into psychic essence to be absorbed by you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).

On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and is reduced to 0 hit points, their essence being absorbed by you. You gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt (rounded down) and have a feeling of enhanced psionic energy, gaining advantage on your next attack roll or ability check.
On a successful save, the target takes half damage and remains conscious, but they suffer disadvantage on their next attack roll or ability check as they feel the psychic pressure.

Psychic Disruption: The intense psychic noise generated by this spell creates a palpable aura of discomfort. All creatures within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or feel uncomfortable, suffering disadvantage on their next attack roll or saving throw as they recoil from the experience. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw and take an additional {@damage 2d10} psychic damage. Additionally, the duration of the discomfort for nearby creatures increases to 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
6th level: The damage increases to {@damage 7d10} psychic damage.
7th level: You gain temporary hit points equal to the full damage dealt (instead of half).
8th level: The radius of the psychic disruption increases to 60 feet.

spell.name: EMP Blow
entries: The caster channels a surge of electromagnetic energy, delivering a concentrated blow to a target. Choose one creature within range; it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} lightning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}. This spell also disrupts electronics in a 10-foot radius around the target, causing them to malfunction for 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Eclipse
entries: You create an area of unnatural darkness that obscures vision and dampens sound. Choose a point within range; a 20-foot radius sphere of magical darkness spreads from that point. Non-magical light can't illuminate the area, and creatures within the darkness are considered to be in dim light.

While in this area, creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on Perception checks and attack rolls. Creatures that are already in dim light or darkness when the spell is cast have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the darkness increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Electrify
entries: The caster channels a powerful electric charge that can be directed at a target within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage and become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}. While the spell is active, the caster can use a bonus action on subsequent turns to maintain the charge, causing the target to take an additional {@damage 2d10} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell level above 5th.

spell.name: Enchant Quality

components.m: (a small piece of the item to be enchanted)

entries: You enhance the quality of a single object, improving its durability or effectiveness. This spell can add a bonus to a weapon’s damage rolls, increase the effectiveness of a tool, or grant temporary enhancements to an item. The caster's proficiency bonus is added to the enhanced quality.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Energy Dump
entries: You channel your own energy to purge the fatigue of a nearby ally, revitalizing them while depleting your own strength. Choose one creature within range; that creature feels a rush of renewed vigor.
Target: One willing creature within range.
Saving Throw: None
Effect on Target: The target regains a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier{@dice  + 2d8} and is cured of the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition if they have it.
Effect on Caster: After the spell is cast, you suffer one level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}.
{@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} Levels:
1st Level: Disadvantage on ability checks.
2nd Level: Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.
3rd Level: Speed halved.
4th Level: Hit point maximum halved.
5th Level: Death.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a captivating spell that enthralls the minds of creatures within range. Choose up to three creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. The {@condition charmed} target regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. They cannot take actions or reactions, and they must make a new saving throw at the end of each of their turns. If the target takes damage from any source, it has advantage on this saving throw.
If the target succeeds on the saving throw or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this spell for the next 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Essence Transfer
entries: You reach out and connect your life force with that of another creature, allowing you to transfer vitality or attributes between you and the target. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects:

Vitality Transfer: You can transfer a portion of your hit points to the target. You lose hit points equal to half your maximum hit points (rounded down), and the target regains hit points equal to the amount lost.

Attribute Exchange: Choose one ability score (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma). You can transfer a temporary +2 bonus from your chosen ability score to the target for 1 minute, while you suffer a -2 penalty to that same ability score for the duration.

Skill Sharing: You can transfer a skill proficiency for a limited time. The target gains proficiency in one skill you are proficient in for 1 hour, while you lose that proficiency for the same duration.
Effects:
The target must be willing to accept the transfer.
You cannot use this spell again until you finish a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, you can transfer an additional +1 to the ability score or additional hit points per spell slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Explosion
entries: You create a micro skipgate linked to reservoirs of volatile organic chemicals beneath the earth, sparking a fiery eruption at a point you can see within range. Burning gases burst outwards, and erratic sprays of chemfuel coat everything in the area.
Creatures in the Area: Each creature within a 15-foot radius sphere centered on the point must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage and is covered in chemfuel, catching on fire.
On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and does not catch on fire.
Catching Fire: A creature ignited by chemfuel takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the flames are extinguished (requiring an action).
Flammable Objects and Terrain: All flammable objects and ground surfaces within the blast radius ignite, spreading flames across the battlefield.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Extinguish Flame
entries: You briefly open skipgates linked to the fire suppression systems of nearby ships, misplacing vast quantities of fire-suppressing foam into the world around you. All flames within a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range are extinguished. This includes both mundane and magical fire.
Creatures in the Area: Each creature within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier) or become coated in firefoam.
On a failed save: The creature is coated in foam and {@condition grappled} (escape DC 15) until the foam is removed or they use an action to free themselves.
On a successful save: The creature avoids the foam but is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

Environmental Impact: Flammable objects and terrain within the area are soaked with foam and rendered non-flammable for 1 hour. This area also becomes difficult terrain until the foam dissipates after 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, the radius of the effect increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Eye Blast
entries: Two unidirectional skipgates materialize in front of your eyes, linking to a white dwarf star and releasing beams of searing energy. A line of 5 feet wide and 60 feet long shoots from you in a direction you choose. The beam burns through everything in its path, scorching the ground and igniting the air.
Creatures in the Line: Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target takes {@damage 6d8} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.
On a successful save: The creature takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

Flammable Terrain and Objects: The beam leaves behind a 10-foot radius patch of blazing fire at the point where it ends, turning the ground into difficult terrain until the flames burn out in 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Farskip
entries: You create a powerful skipgate that allows you to teleport yourself and up to three willing creatures within range to a location you can see or visualize within 500 feet. The destination must be an unoccupied space, and you must have either visited it before or have a clear understanding of the location's layout.
Upon arrival, all creatures teleported regain {@dice 1d8} hit points as they are reinvigorated by the surge of psychic energy that accompanies the teleportation.
If any teleportation target is unwilling, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC to resist the effect. Creatures that fail are immediately transported alongside you.

This spell has the added benefit of allowing you to skip through walls or barriers, provided they are not thicker than 5 feet. Creatures in the immediate vicinity of the destination must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} force damage as they are displaced by the sudden influx of energy.

spell.name: Fatal Blow
entries: The caster channels their primal fury into a single devastating strike. Make a melee weapon attack against a creature within reach. On a hit, the attack deals {@damage 8d10} slashing damage. Additionally, if the target is below half its hit points, the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage, as the caster taps into the life force of the target to enhance their strike.
Furthermore, if the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, the caster gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the slashing damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Field Of Inhibition
entries: Create a field that suppresses magical effects within a 20-foot radius. Any spell of 3rd level or lower cast within the area automatically fails, and spells of higher levels must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to function.

spell.name: Fire Beam

components.m: (a piece of liquid oxygen, which evaporates upon casting)

entries: You attempt to channel the power of a star into a concentrated column of near-liquidized oxygen, creating a devastating plasma beam that erupts forward in a straight line.
Area of Effect: A line that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long erupts from you in a direction you choose.
Creatures in the Line: Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target takes {@damage 8d10} fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
On a successful save: The target takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}.
Flammable Objects: Any flammable object in the area that isn’t being worn or carried ignites.
Aftermath:

After casting this spell, the immense psychic strain causes you to fall into a coma for 6 hours. During this time, you cannot take actions, maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}, or be awakened except by Heal or similar magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level or higher slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Fire Shield
entries: You create a blazing, swirling vortex of plasma energy around a creature within range, linked to a distant stellar flame. For the duration, the target is surrounded by whirling fire that extends 3 inches from their body. Anyone who strikes the shielded creature with a melee attack suffers the wrath of this celestial heat.

Melee Retaliation: Whenever a creature within 5 feet hits the shielded target with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or catch on fire.
An ignited creature takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the flames are extinguished (requiring an action).

Overpowering Fire: Any existing fire effects on the shielded target are absorbed and magnified by this spell. While the shield persists, the target becomes immune to fire damage and any flames touching them are extinguished, replaced by the stellar flames of the shield.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, the retaliatory fire damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fire Tornado

components.m: (a small piece of ash from a fire elemental)

entries: You create a swirling vortex of flames and concentrated oxygen at a point you can see within range. This tornado of fire begins to churn and expand, causing chaotic reactions as it rips through the environment.
Area of Effect: The fire tornado occupies a 10-foot radius, 30-foot tall cylinder that extends from the ground upward.
Initial Impact: When the tornado appears, each creature within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target takes {@damage 6d10} fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.
On a successful save: The target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.
Ongoing Effects:
Movement: While you maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the spell, the tornado moves 20 feet in a random direction at the start of each of your turns, determined by rolling a {@dice d8}:
North
Northeast
East
Southeast
South
Southwest
West
Northwest

Flammable Byproducts: At the end of each of your turns while the tornado persists, any creature within the tornado's area of effect must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be set on fire, taking {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of their next turn.
Terrain: The area affected by the tornado becomes difficult terrain, as everything within is scorched and thrown into chaos.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level or higher slot, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Firing Focus
entries: Channel a heightened focus on ranged weaponry. For the duration, you gain advantage on ranged attack rolls, and critical hits are achieved on a roll of 19 or 20. If you take any melee damage while under this effect, you must make a {@status Concentration|XPHB} saving throw to maintain it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the critical hit range increases by an additional 1 for each slot level above 2nd (e.g., 18-20 for a 3rd-level slot).

spell.name: Flameball
entries: You create a small volatile pod of molten magma and hurl it at a point within range. Upon impact, the pod bursts, releasing a splash of magma in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on the target point.

Creatures in the Area: Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage, or half as much on a success.
Flammable Objects: Any unattended, flammable objects within the radius ignite and burn until extinguished.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd-level or higher psionic slot, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Flashstorm
entries: You summon a violent storm of electrical energy in a location of your choice within range.
Effect: Choose a point within range. A 30-foot-radius sphere of crackling electricity forms centered on that point. The area is heavily obscured and counts as difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} lightning damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t {@condition blinded}.
Additionally, the storm creates a flash of light that illuminates the area for the duration, allowing creatures within to see normally despite the obscured vision.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Focus
entries: You center your mind, drawing upon inner strength and clarity. For the duration of the spell, you gain the following benefits:
Advantage on {@status Concentration|XPHB} Checks: You have advantage on any saving throws you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on spells.
Increased Focus: You can choose to gain a bonus to your spell save DC or your spell attack rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier for the duration.
If you take damage while {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to your saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can choose one additional benefit from the above list for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Forced Relocation

components.m: (a small piece of twine or thread)

entries: You attempt to forcibly pull a creature of your choice within range toward you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be teleported to a point you designate within 10 feet of you. If the target is unwilling or larger than Medium size, it has advantage on the saving throw.
If the creature is teleported into an occupied space, it is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space within range. This effect is considered magical forced movement.

spell.name: Forced Retreat
entries: Target a creature within range, forcing it to move back 10 feet away from the caster. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed back.

spell.name: Frost Ray
entries: You create a beam of freezing energy and hurl it at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

On a hit: The target takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn as ice encases it temporarily.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fungal Skin
entries: Infuses the target's skin with a rapidly growing fungal layer, providing additional protection. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC for the duration, and any melee attack against them has a 50% chance to become entangled in the fungus, imposing disadvantage on the attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the AC bonus increases by 1 for each spell level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ghost Walk
entries: ou step into the Ethereal Plane, becoming incorporeal and gaining the ability to move through solid objects. For the duration, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take {@damage 1d10} force damage if you end your turn inside an object.

While in this state, you are immune to all non-magical damage and cannot be targeted by attacks or spells that rely on physical presence. However, you cannot interact with the physical world, meaning you cannot make attacks or use any physical items.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can increase the duration by 10 minutes for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Greater Ocular Sprout

components.m: (a sprig from a flowering plant and a drop of your blood)

entries: You summon a more powerful version of the Ocular Sprout, which blossoms into a larger, multi-eyed creature that orbits around you. The Greater Ocular Sprout enhances your perception and grants additional benefits:

Heightened Vision: You gain advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks and can see in dim light as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Telepathic Sight: You can communicate telepathically with the Greater Ocular Sprout, which can scout areas up to 60 feet away from you. It can relay visual information and alert you to potential threats.
Side Effects:

Casting this spell deepens your connection to the unseen, causing your mind to slightly warp. After the spell ends, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1-2, you experience a brief moment of paranoia or anxiety, imposing disadvantage on your next saving throw against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd. Additionally, the Greater Ocular Sprout gains an additional ability: once per turn, you can use your bonus action to have it grant you advantage on one attack roll or saving throw.

spell.name: Group Link
entries: You create a sphere of psychic suggestion with a 10-foot radius centered on yourself. For the duration, all willing creatures within this sphere are linked to you psychically. While linked, you can use your “Word of” psionic powers on any creature within the sphere, affecting all linked targets simultaneously.
Linked Benefits:
Shared Focus: All linked creatures have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} while within the sphere.
Communal Awareness: You and the linked creatures can communicate telepathically within the radius, sharing thoughts and strategies without speaking aloud.
If a linked creature moves out of the 30-foot range, the link is broken for that creature, and they lose the benefits of the shared link.

Psychic Sensitivity: If any of the linked creatures are psychically sensitive, they gain an additional +1 bonus to their saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} while linked.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
4th level: The radius of the effect increases 15 feet.
5th level: The duration increases to 1 hour, and you can link an additional creature for each level above 3rd, provided they are willing.

spell.name: Guardian Skipbarrier

components.m: (a small piece of glass or crystal)

entries: You create a powerful barrier that protects a target within range. The Guardian Skipbarrier shields the recipient from harm and grants them enhanced mobility.
Barrier Protection: The target gains a +2 bonus to AC and has resistance to all damage types while the barrier is active.
Skip Effect: The target can teleport up to 30 feet as a reaction to taking damage, reappearing in an unoccupied space they can see. This teleportation does not provoke opportunity attacks.
The barrier remains active for the duration or until it has absorbed a total of 50 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage threshold increases by 10 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Guided Shot
entries: Imbue your next ranged attack with uncanny accuracy, psychically guiding your shot to bypass obstacles and strike your intended target. For the duration, you gain advantage on one ranged attack per turn, and the attack ignores half and three-quarters cover. If you miss, you can roll again, re-rolling damage for the second hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell duration increases by 1 minute for each level above 4th, and you gain an additional re-roll attempt if the first two attempts fail, giving you exceptional accuracy.

spell.name: Haywire
entries: You disrupt the functionality of a technological device or machine within range, causing it to malfunction. The target device must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for the duration. While {@condition incapacitated}, it operates erratically, possibly damaging itself or affecting nearby objects and creatures in a 10-foot radius. At the end of each of its turns, the device can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional device for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Health Swap
entries: You can choose two willing creatures within range and swap their current hit points. This exchange can help a severely injured ally while leaving the healthier target in a less critical state.
Choose Targets: Both targets must be willing; they can consent to the swap or the spell fails if either one does not agree.

Hit Point Exchange: The current hit points of both creatures are exchanged. If a creature has a maximum hit point limit, it cannot exceed this limit when gaining hit points through the swap. If either target has 0 hit points, they are treated as {@condition unconscious} for the purpose of this spell but can still have their hit points swapped with another creature.
Aftermath: Any temporary hit points are not affected by this spell and remain with their original creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can swap the hit points of one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Heat Focus
entries: You target one creature within range and manipulate their internal temperature, causing discomfort and disorientation. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for the duration of the spell.

While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you can use your bonus action to maintain or enhance the effect, allowing the target to repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a success, the spell ends for them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hover
entries: Confers the ability of limited psychic flight, allowing the target to hop and glide small distances over terrain. The target ignores terrain movement costs for the duration of the ability, enabling easier navigation over difficult surfaces or obstacles.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the duration increases by an additional 5 minutes for each spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Hurricane
entries: You unleash the fury of nature in a localized storm that ravages everything in its path.
Effect: Choose a point within range; a massive hurricane forms in a 60-foot radius centered on that point. The area becomes heavily obscured, and winds gust at high speeds.

Each creature within the area must make a Strength saving throw at the start of its turn. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the center of the hurricane. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not pushed.
Additionally, ranged weapon attacks made within the area have disadvantage, and spells requiring verbal components are difficult to cast, requiring an additional action to successfully cast them.
The hurricane lasts for the duration, and you can move it up to 30 feet as part of your movement on your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Ice Block
entries: You encase a creature within a block of ice, temporarily immobilizing them. Choose a creature within range that you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save: The target is {@condition restrained} and encased in a block of ice, taking {@damage 4d10} cold damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
On a successful save: The target takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}.
Additional Effects:

The ice block has AC 15 and hit points equal to 5 times your psychic sensitivity. It is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. If the block is reduced to 0 hit points, it shatters, freeing the creature inside, and the target takes an additional {@damage 2d10} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ice Crystal
entries: You conjure a shard of ice that hovers at a point you can see within range. As a bonus action on your turn, you can direct the crystal to attack a creature within 5 feet of it.

Attack Roll: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ice Shield
entries: You create a protective barrier of swirling ice around yourself, enhancing your defense against physical attacks.
Temporary Hit Points: You gain 5 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points last for the duration of the spell or until they are depleted.
Ice Armor: If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these temporary hit points, the attacker takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage as shards of ice erupt from your shield.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 2 for each slot level above 1st, and the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Spike
entries: You create a sharp icicle of condensed vapor and launch it at a target within range. The icicle pierces through the air and strikes the target, dealing cold damage.
Attack Roll: Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
On a hit: The target takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Wall
entries: ou conjure a wall of solid ice that springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall can be up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any configuration you desire, but it must be contiguous.
Wall Properties:
The wall has AC 12 and 30 hit points.

Any creature that attempts to pass through the wall must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} cold damage and be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}.
Destruction:
The wall is considered difficult terrain for creatures that can’t pass through it. If the wall takes damage, it can be destroyed, and it breaks if it drops to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the wall's hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 4th. Additionally, the cold damage dealt by the wall increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Impediment
entries: Target a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks for the duration.

spell.name: Intensify Shadows
entries: You amplify the shadows in a designated area, causing them to deepen and expand. Choose a point within range; a 20-foot radius sphere of magical darkness emanates from that point. The darkness is considered magical and cannot be illuminated by non-magical light.

While in this area, creatures other than you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. Additionally, ranged attacks made from within this darkness have advantage, while attacks made against creatures within the darkness have disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the darkness increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Invisibility
entries: You touch a creature, making it {@condition invisible} for the duration. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the target’s person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.
If the target makes an attack or casts a spell, the effect ends, and the target becomes visible.
Creatures can make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to perceive the {@condition invisible} target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: KO
entries: The caster channels their inner ferocity and targets a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition unconscious} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition unconscious}.
If the target is already below half of its hit points, it automatically fails the saving throw, making it prone to the full effect of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Killskip
entries: Channeling lethal energy, you open a deadly skipgate around a target within range, causing the target to briefly vanish and reappear with a violent impact. The sudden jolt deals {@damage 8d8} force damage as the abrupt transposition disorients the target, fracturing their mind and body. The spell has a 50% chance to interrupt {@status Concentration|XPHB} on any spells they may be maintaining.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, add {@dice 2d8} additional force damage for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Leap
entries: You channel energy to propel yourself through the air. You can leap up to 30 feet in any direction without provoking opportunity attacks. This leap can clear obstacles, allowing you to bypass difficult terrain or reach higher ground quickly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the distance you can leap increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Leaping Charge
entries: The caster harnesses primal energy, allowing them to leap a great distance towards an enemy. The caster can jump up to 30 feet in a straight line, landing within melee range of the target. Upon landing, the caster makes a melee attack against the target, dealing an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage on a hit. If the attack hits, the target must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the force damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Leg Skip

components.m: (a small piece of metal shaped like a foot)

entries: The caster enhances their agility and speed, allowing them to teleport short distances with each step. For the duration, the caster can choose to skip up to 30 feet in any direction as part of their movement. When the caster skips, they leave behind a brief afterimage that confuses enemies, giving them disadvantage on opportunity attacks made against the caster until the start of their next turn. Additionally, if the caster skips to a space within 10 feet of an enemy, that enemy must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the enemy takes {@damage 4d10} slashing damage as the caster's legs create a slicing wind upon skipping.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the slashing damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Life Rot
entries: You inflict a debilitating rot upon a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration.

While affected, the target also takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Light Sustenance
entries: The caster creates a glowing orb of light that hovers near a target creature, providing nourishment and energy. The target does not require food or drink for the duration of the spell and gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} at the start of each of their turns. The orb provides dim light in a 10-foot radius and can be moved as a bonus action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the temporary hit points increase by {@dice 1d6} for each spell level above 3rd.

spell.name: Location Swap
entries: You target two willing creatures within range and swap their positions instantly. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other and must have a clear path to their new locations.
If the targeted creatures are unwilling or if the swap would cause one of the creatures to occupy an occupied space, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional willing creature for each slot level above 3rd, swapping their positions with the others as long as they are all within range.

spell.name: Luck Transfer
entries: You manipulate the threads of fate to transfer luck between yourself and an ally within range. When you cast this spell, you take disadvantage on your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw before the spell ends. In return, you grant the chosen ally within range advantage on their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
You can choose to end this effect on your turn as a bonus action, allowing you to regain normal fortune at the cost of the effect continuing for the ally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can transfer luck to one additional ally for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Manhunter Pulse
entries: You release a pulse of energy that resonates with the essence of nearby creatures. Choose a point within range; all creatures within a 30-foot radius must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, affected creatures become aware of any hostile creatures' presence within the area, feeling an instinctive urge to attack.

While under the influence of Manhunter Pulse, affected creatures have advantage on attack rolls against any creature they can perceive as hostile within the area. Additionally, if a creature fails its saving throw, it cannot willingly move more than 10 feet away from any hostile creature for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, the radius of the pulse increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mass Beckon
entries: With a commanding gesture, you psychically pull multiple enemies within range toward a central point of your choosing. Choose up to five creatures within range that must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, each creature is pulled up to 20 feet closer to the designated point and is momentarily {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. This spell can disrupt groups of opponents, forcing them into a vulnerable position.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you may target an additional creature for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Mass Chaos Skip
entries: You create a vast chaotic skipgate that affects multiple creatures or objects within a designated area. Choose up to three creatures or objects you can see within range. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled through the skipgate and relocated to a random position within 30 feet of its original location.
The new locations for each target are determined separately, using the following table:
{@dice d6}	Location Description
1	Directly behind the caster
2	10 feet to the left of the target
3	10 feet to the right of the target
4	15 feet straight up
5	15 feet straight down
6	A random point within a 30-foot radius, determined by the DM
If a target is unwilling, it can attempt a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it remains in its original location and the spell fails.
