Additionally, any creature within 10 feet of the targeted creatures when they reappear must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Mass Hallucination
entries: You unleash a massive burst of psychic energy that creates vivid and convincing hallucinations in the minds of all creatures of your choice within a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the creatures perceive the surroundings as magnificent and ideal, believing that the environment is the absolute best it could possibly be.
Effects of the Hallucination:
Affected creatures cannot take hostile actions and are {@condition charmed} by the environment, believing it is a safe haven.
They may spend their time interacting with the hallucination, such as admiring the beauty or enjoying imaginary comforts, treating the area as if it provides real benefits (e.g., rest, safety).
Creatures can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

Caster's Coma: As a side effect of the immense psychic exertion required to maintain this spell, you fall into a coma immediately after casting. You remain in a comatose state until you are shaken awake (by an ally or through magical means). During this time, you are {@condition unconscious} and unaware of your surroundings.

Psychic Sensitivity: If any affected creature is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw and remain under the influence of the hallucination for 1 additional minute unless freed by a Greater Restoration or similar magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
6th level: The radius of the effect increases to 40 feet.
7th level: The duration of the hallucination extends to 10 minutes, and the caster's coma is reduced to no coma (you remain conscious).

spell.name: Mend

components.m: (two pieces of the object to be mended)

entries: You weave together broken or damaged objects, repairing them to their original condition. This spell can fix small items, such as a broken tool, piece of clothing, or a shattered window. The maximum size of the object that can be repaired is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can repair an additional foot in size for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Meteor Shower
entries: You create gravitational distortions that redirect orbiting meteoroids and space debris toward locations you choose within range. The meteoroids fall in 4 separate impact points, dealing explosive force and fire damage.
When you cast this spell, select 4 points you can see within range. Each point must be within 30 feet of another.
Impact: Each creature within a 10-foot radius sphere centered on each point must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d6} fire damage from the impact and debris.
On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.
{@condition Prone|XPHB}: Any creature that fails the saving throw is also knocked {@condition prone} by the force of the explosion.

Flammable Objects and Terrain: Any flammable terrain or objects caught in the area ignite, and the ground in the affected areas is left scorched and difficult to traverse, becoming difficult terrain until cleared.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, the fire or bludgeoning damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Mind Break
entries: You unleash concentrated psychic energy that overwhelms a creature’s mind, effectively lobotomizing them and rendering them a thrall to your will. Choose one creature within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target:
Loses their ability to take actions except to move towards you or obey your commands, which can be verbal or nonverbal.
Acts as a thrall, following your commands to the best of their ability.
Can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
On a successful save, the target takes half damage and suffers no additional effects.
Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, they take an additional {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
5th level: The damage increases to {@damage 7d10} psychic damage.
6th level: The duration extends to 2 rounds, and you can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell while {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on another spell.
7th level: The number of targets increases to two creatures within range, provided they are within 10 feet of each other.

spell.name: Mind Control
entries: You exert a degree of influence over the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you can control the target's actions on its next turn, but you can only command it to use a single action or move up to its movement speed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Creatures with Intelligence scores of 3 or lower are immune to this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature within range for each slot level above 1st. Each target must make its own saving throw.

spell.name: Mind Wipe
entries: You induce a brief state of retrograde amnesia in a creature, causing them to forget all memories and social connections formed outside their background. The target feels an inexplicable kinship with your colony and experiences joy in rediscovering life’s pleasures without the burden of past commitments.
Target: One creature within range.
Saving Throw: The target can make an Intelligence saving throw to resist the effects of the spell.

On a failed save: The target loses all memories and social connections acquired outside their backstory, effectively wiping away their knowledge of skills, relationships, and experiences. The target feels an overwhelming sense of joy and kinship towards you and your allies, treating them as friends for the duration of the spell.
On a successful save: The target retains all memories and is unaffected by the spell.
Aftereffects:

The target’s mind is clouded, and they are unable to recall any information or skills gained from experiences outside their backstory, which lasts until they receive a Greater Restoration spell, Wish spell, or similar magic. They may also gain an emotional bond with the caster's colony, considering it a place of refuge and happiness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher slot, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Neural Heat Detonations
entries: You release all your neural heat in a powerful explosion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within a 30-foot radius of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: Creatures take {@damage 8d10} psychic damage and are knocked {@condition prone}.
On a successful save: Creatures take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.
Area of Effect:
The explosion creates a 30-foot radius sphere centered on the chosen point.
Psychic Sensitivity:
If any target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw, and if they fail, they take an additional {@damage 3d10} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
5th level: The damage increases to {@dice 10d10} and the radius of the explosion increases to 40 feet.

spell.name: Neural Heat Dump
entries: You transfer your neural heat to a willing ally you can touch. The target must accept the psychic invasion; if they do, they fall into a harmless coma for 2 turns. During this time, they cannot take actions, reactions, or move.
While in a coma: The target restores all expended spell slots  of a caster (up to a maximum of 3rd level).
If the target does not accept the invasion, the action is wasted, and nothing occurs.
Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the initial acceptance of the psychic invasion. If they succeed, the benefits remain unchanged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
3rd level: The duration of the coma decreased to 1 turn.
4th level: You can restore an additional expended spell slot (up to a maximum of 4th level).

spell.name: Neuroquake
entries: You find a rupture in the psychic field and unleash a massive wave of psychic energy, causing a Neuroquake. Choose a point within range; a 60-foot radius sphere emanates from that point.
Safe Inner Circle: Creatures within a 20-foot radius of the center are safe from the effects of the Neuroquake. Creatures in this safe area are unaffected.
Insanity Effect:
Creatures outside the inner circle: Each creature within the affected area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The creature is driven insane for 1 minute (refer to the confusion condition for specific mechanics), becoming {@condition frightened} and unable to discern friend from foe.
On a successful save: The creature takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage and is not driven insane, but they suffer disadvantage on all attacks for the next round due to the echoes of psychic pain.
Pain Echoes:

All creatures within the affected area (including those in the inner circle) feel the disturbing echoes of the Neuroquake, taking {@damage 1d6} psychic damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute.
Coma Effect:
After casting this spell, you fall into a psychic coma lasting for 1 day (or until cured) as the overwhelming psychic energy drains your consciousness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
5th level: The damage dealt to creatures outside the safe inner circle increases to {@dice 6d10}.
5th level: The radius of the effect increases to 80 feet.

spell.name: Nightstep
entries: You blend seamlessly with the shadows, becoming almost ethereal. For the duration, you can move through areas of dim light or darkness as if they were difficult terrain. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

While in dim light or darkness, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and you can use your action to become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn. Additionally, if you end your turn in dim light or darkness, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see within that area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can increase the teleportation distance by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Obscure
entries: You manipulate the ambient light and shadows to obscure a target creature or object within range. The target becomes heavily obscured, making it difficult for creatures to see or target them effectively.

While obscured, the target gains advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide and can move through the area without leaving tracks. Additionally, creatures attempting to attack the target have disadvantage on their attack rolls.
If the target moves more than 60 feet away from the point of origin, the effect ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can affect one additional target for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ocular Eruption

components.m: (a small gemstone worth at least 100 gold pieces, shattered)

entries: You unleash a catastrophic burst of psychic energy from your very being, causing a violent eruption of eyes and dark energy that radiates outward in a 30-foot radius. All creatures within the area must make a Constitution saving throw.

Damage: On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

Ocular Horror: Additionally, any creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn, overwhelmed by the sight of the erupting eyes and the psychic energy coursing through the area.
Side Effects:

After casting this spell, you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer from temporary madness as a result of the chaotic energy released. Roll on the Short-Term Madness table from the Dungeon Master's Guide or apply a condition of your choice that represents your character's mental distress.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th, and the radius of the effect increases by 5 feet.

spell.name: Ocular Sprout

components.m: (a small seed and a drop of your blood)

entries: You cause a small seed to sprout from your body, growing into a plant-like creature with multiple eyes. The Ocular Sprout hovers around you and provides assistance in various tasks. While the Ocular Sprout is active, you gain the following benefits:
Enhanced Vision: You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
Telepathic Link: You can communicate telepathically with the Ocular Sprout, allowing it to relay information about your surroundings within a range of 30 feet.
Side Effects:

Casting this spell may have a slight effect on your psyche. At the end of the duration, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1, you gain a temporary quirk reflecting the eccentric nature of the Ocular Sprout, which lasts until you finish a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 1st. Additionally, the Ocular Sprout gains an additional eye, allowing it to provide you with an additional advantage on one perception check during the spell's duration.

spell.name: Overshield

components.m: (a small piece of metal from a shield)

entries: You create a protective barrier around a creature you touch, granting them additional resilience. The target gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier. While these temporary hit points are active, the target also gains the following benefits:
Resistance to Damage: The target has resistance to one damage type of your choice (acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder).
Enhanced Defense: The target has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
If the temporary hit points are reduced to 0, the spell ends immediately.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Painblock
entries: You touch a willing creature and create a shield of psychic energy that dulls their sense of pain. For the duration, the target has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while under the effects of this spell, they remain conscious and can make one attack or use one action before falling {@condition unconscious}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 5 minutes for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Paralysis Pulse

components.m: (a small vial of liquid from a paralysis-inducing creature)

entries: You unleash a wave of necrotic energy in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. While {@condition paralyzed} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or speak.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature takes damage while {@condition paralyzed} in this way, it can immediately make another Constitution saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Paralyzing Grasp
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. If the target succeeds on a Constitution saving throw, the effect ends immediately.

spell.name: Plant Timeskip
entries: You manipulate the flow of time within a 10-foot radius around you, accelerating the growth of all non-sentient plants within range to full maturity. This can:
Instantly grow crops to harvestable maturity.
Restore withered plants to their healthiest state.
Cause any flowering plants or vines to blossom immediately.
Trees may sprout additional fruit or flowers, depending on their natural cycle.
Note: This spell does not affect sentient plant creatures (such as treants) or magically grown plants unless the DM allows otherwise.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a psionic slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Power
entries: You enhance the functionality of a technological device or machine within range, granting it temporary improvements. The target device gains a +2 bonus to any rolls it makes (such as attack rolls, damage rolls, or skill checks) for the duration. If the device has a mechanical function, it operates at peak efficiency, allowing it to perform at double its normal capacity.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional device for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Psychic Drone
entries: You create a massive psychic aura that radiates from you in a 30-foot radius. Hostile creatures within this area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier) at the start of their turn.

On a failed save: The creature becomes {@condition frightened} and must use its action to move as far away from you as possible on its turn. While {@condition frightened}, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage at the end of each of its turns.
On a successful save: The creature is unaffected and can act normally.
Breaking the Effect:

A creature that is {@condition frightened} by this effect can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Additionally, if the creature takes damage from any source, it can make an immediate saving throw against the spell.
Psychic Sensitivity:
If a hostile creature is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on their saving throws against this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
5th level: The psychic damage increases to {@dice 3d6} and the radius of the aura increases to 40 feet.
5th level: You can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on the spell for an additional 1 round.

spell.name: Psychic Guidance
entries: You tap into the currents of probability and luck, guiding your next actions. For the duration of the spell, you gain a bonus to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw of your choice. The bonus equals your psychic sensitivity modifier (minimum of +1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature within 30 feet of you for each slot level above 1st. Each target gains the same benefits as you.

spell.name: Psychic Shock
entries: You unleash a barrage of chaotic psychic imagery into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn and takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.
On a successful save: The target takes half damage and suffers no other effects.
Psychic Shock Condition:

While affected by this spell, if the target takes damage from any source, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell DC. On a failed save, they suffer {@damage 1d8} psychic damage as they struggle to regain control of their senses.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
3rd level: The psychic damage increases to {@dice 4d8}.
4th level: The duration of the blindness and deafness increases to 2 turns.

spell.name: Psychic Soothe (Female)
entries: You project a wave of calming psychic energy, soothing the minds of your allies and easing their emotional turmoil. Choose any number of creatures within range; they are filled with a sense of peace and clarity.
Target: Any number of creatures of your choice within range.
Saving Throw: Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save: Affected creatures gain the following benefits for the duration:
Advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
Temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of their turn.
On a successful save: The target is unaffected.
{@status Concentration|XPHB} and Effects:

While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, if you take damage, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the spell ends for all affected targets.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Psychic Soothe (Male)
entries: You emit a powerful wave of psychic energy that inspires confidence and camaraderie among your allies, allowing them to perform better in combat and social situations. Choose any number of creatures within range; they feel a surge of positive emotions and empowerment.
Target: Any number of creatures of your choice within range.
Saving Throw: Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failed save: Affected creatures gain the following benefits for the duration:
Advantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
Temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of their turn.
On a successful save: The target is unaffected.
{@status Concentration|XPHB} and Effects:

While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, if you take damage, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you lose {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the spell ends for all affected targets.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher slot, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Raid Pause

components.m: (a small hourglass or other timekeeping device)

entries: You manipulate the flow of time around a group of raiders, inducing a state of stasis that freezes them in place. Choose up to 3 creatures within range. Those targets must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier) or be slowed to a complete stop for the duration.
While affected, they cannot move, take actions, or react to stimuli.
Attacking any affected raider immediately jolts them back into action, ending the effect for all affected creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher psionic slot:
You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Recharge
entries: You channel static electricity into a device or creature, revitalizing it with energy.

Effect: Choose a device or creature within range. If targeting a device, it regains a number of uses equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1) and can be recharged within the duration. If targeting a creature, they regain a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Failure: If the target is an enemy, they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn as the sudden surge of energy overwhelms them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Regeneration

components.m: (a small piece of a creature's flesh)

entries: The caster initiates a process that accelerates their natural healing, allowing them to regain lost hit points. At the start of each of their turns while the spell is active, the caster regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the caster is reduced to 0 hit points while under the effects of this spell, they automatically stabilize. Additionally, if the caster loses a limb during the duration of the spell, it regrows after {@dice 1d6} minutes, fully functional.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell level above 4th.

spell.name: Regrow Limbs

components.m: (a small portion of a similar limb)

entries: You restore a severed limb or appendage of a creature you touch, fully regrowing it and returning its functionality. This spell can be used on any creature with a missing limb, whether due to injury or amputation. The regrown limb functions as if it had never been lost, and the target regains any lost functionality, such as movement or manipulation of objects.
The target must have been alive at the time of casting; this spell cannot bring back limbs of creatures that are dead.
The creature regains any lost hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
If you cast this spell on a creature that has lost multiple limbs, you can choose to regrow one limb per casting.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can restore one additional limb for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Restrict Movement
entries: Choose a target within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be restricted in movement, suffering disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws for the duration.

spell.name: Resurrect

components.m: (a diamond worth at least 500 gold pieces)

entries: You reach out to the forces of life and death, channeling your power to restore life to a creature that has died within the last 10 days. The target returns to life with full hit points and is no longer affected by any effects that caused it to die, except for effects that would naturally persist after death, such as curses or certain diseases.

The target must have a soul willing to return, or else the spell fails. If the creature’s body is missing parts, it is reformed as best as possible, but any permanent damage that the body had prior to death remains.

After being resurrected, the creature is exhausted (as per the {@condition exhaustion} rules) and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer from one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 1 day for each slot level above 5th, allowing you to resurrect creatures that have been dead for longer.

spell.name: Reunion Farskip
entries: You focus your mind on the bonds of closeness and tap into the psychic connections with those you consider extremely close. You summon all individuals within range who share a deep emotional bond with you to your location, rendering them {@condition unconscious} due to psychic shock.
Target: Up to three creatures within range who are considered extremely close allies or friends.
Saving Throw: Each target can make a Constitution saving throw to resist the effects of the spell.
On a failed save: The affected creatures are summoned to your location and knocked {@condition unconscious}. They have no memory of how they arrived and will be confused upon awakening.
On a successful save: The targets remain in their original locations, and the spell fails to take effect.
Social Consequences:

Using this spell may be seen as an overwhelming intrusion by the summoned individuals. While they may have a bond with you, their sudden arrival can cause confusion and mistrust, especially if they have unresolved feelings about your relationship.
Aftereffects:
Upon completion of the spell, you immediately fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 day, during which you are {@condition incapacitated} and unaware of your surroundings.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level or higher slot, you can summon one additional target for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Reverse Engineer

components.m: (a small piece of the technology you wish to reverse engineer)

entries: You can analyze and dismantle a piece of technology or magical device to understand its inner workings. Upon casting this spell, you touch a technological or magical item, and after a brief examination, you gain insights that allow you to replicate the item’s effects or features.
You can choose to:

Replicate: Create a copy of the item (or a similar item) as long as you possess the necessary materials and tools. The copied item retains the basic properties of the original but may lack certain magical enhancements.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can reverse engineer an additional item for each slot level above 5th.

Modify: Temporarily enhance or alter the capabilities of the item. This could include boosting its effectiveness, changing its type, or altering its properties, which lasts until the end of your next long rest.

spell.name: Rock Construct
entries: You create a medium-sized construct made of stone that obeys your commands. The construct has an AC of 16 and hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier times 6. It can take actions as you direct it on your turn, and it can make one melee attack (using your spellcasting modifier for attack rolls) against a target within 5 feet, dealing {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage.
The construct has a speed of 25 feet and can move through difficult terrain without expending extra movement. It can also be ordered to take the Dash, Disengage, or Help actions on your turn.
If the construct is reduced to 0 hit points, it crumbles into rubble.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create an additional construct for each slot level above 3rd, provided that you can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on them.

spell.name: Savage Psychic Slice
entries: Channel a burst of raw psychic energy to create a razor-sharp psychic slice that targets a creature within range. The slice deals psychic damage equal to your psychic sensitivity. If the target is vulnerable to psychic damage, this spell deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Higher Levels: When cast at higher levels, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Season Timeskip

components.m: (a relic tied to the current season, such as a frozen leaf or sunstone)

entries: You expend tremendous psychic power to accelerate the entire world’s timeline forward by one season. All creatures, plants, and environmental systems adjust as if the current season has ended, and the next one has begun. Natural events that would normally occur over the skipped period—such as harvests, migrations, or seasonal weather patterns—happen instantly. The spell cannot rewind time and only moves it forward.
Cost of Casting:
Psychic Coma: The caster immediately falls into a psychic coma for 1 day (24 hours). They are {@condition unconscious} and vulnerable during this time.
Permanent Aging: The caster ages 15 years, experiencing noticeable biological decay. This aging cannot be undone by other psionic powers.
Severe {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}: After waking, the caster suffers 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, requiring time or magical aid to recover fully.

Rare Components: The spell requires rare seasonal relics—one from each season (e.g., a preserved flower from spring, a sunstone, an autumn leaf, and winter frost). These relics must be gathered beforehand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level or higher psionic slot:
Aging is reduced by 5 years per level above 3rd.
{@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} is reduced by 1 level per additional slot level.

spell.name: Self Explosion
entries: You momentarily create a volatile, swirling vortex of ignited gas centered on yourself. The explosion releases with a fiery whoosh, spreading flames to everything nearby but causing minimal direct harm.

Creatures in the Area: Each creature within a 10-foot radius of you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and catches on fire.
On a successful save, the creature takes only half damage and does not catch on fire.

Catching Fire: A creature ignited by this spell takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to extinguish the flames (or another creature can assist).
Flammable Objects: All flammable objects within range ignite and continue burning until extinguished.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a 3rd-level or higher slot, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shadow Focus
entries: You draw upon the shadows surrounding you to sharpen your senses and enhance your abilities. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:
Enhanced Stealth: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while in dim light or darkness.
Heightened Reflexes: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.
Shadowy Strike: The first time you hit with a weapon attack during this spell’s duration, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
If you end your turn in bright light, the spell ends early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the extra necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shadow Skip
entries: You step into the shadows, momentarily becoming incorporeal as you slip through the fabric of light. You can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see, provided that space is in dim light or darkness.

When you use this spell, you leave behind a shadowy afterimage in your original location that lasts until the start of your next turn. Any creature that starts its turn in the space of the afterimage must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can teleport an additional 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shield Animals

components.m: (a feather from a creature of the animal type)

entries: You create a protective aura around a number of animals within range, imbuing them with heightened defenses against threats. Choose up to three creatures of the animal type within range. For the duration of the spell, these animals gain a magical shield that enhances their natural defenses.
Effects:
Damage Resistance: The selected animals gain resistance to damage from attacks and spells for the duration.
Advantage on Saving Throws: The animals have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
Enhanced Mobility: The animals gain a bonus to their movement speed equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 10 feet).

Additionally, if any of the protected animals are reduced to 0 hit points while under the effects of this spell, they are stabilized automatically and remain conscious for 1 round, allowing them to take actions before falling {@condition unconscious}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, you can choose one additional animal for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shrineshield

components.m: (a small piece of stone from a natural shrine)

entries: You create a protective barrier of energy that manifests as an ethereal shield in a designated area, resembling a sacred shrine. This shield provides sanctuary to you and your allies, granting them several benefits while within its radius (up to a 20-foot radius centered on a point you choose).
Effects:
Damage Resistance: Creatures within the area gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
Healing Aura: At the start of each of your turns, you and any allies within the shield regain hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).
Calming Presence: Creatures that start their turn within the shield have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
If the shield is disrupted by an effect that ends {@status Concentration|XPHB}, it collapses immediately, and any creatures within it take {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, the healing aura increases by 1 hit point for each spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Silencing Wave
entries: Emit a wave of energy that silences a target, preventing it from casting spells or making any vocalizations. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be silenced for the duration.

spell.name: Skewer

components.m: (a sharp weapon or a pointed object)

entries: The caster channels their primal instincts to create a spear of energy that streaks towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is impaled, reducing their speed by half until the end of their next turn. If the attack is a critical hit, the target is also considered {@condition grappled} until they succeed on a Strength check against your spellcasting ability.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Skillroll
entries: You manipulate the fabric of chance around yourself, enhancing your skills and those of nearby allies. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects:

Skill Boost: For the duration, you can add a bonus equal to your spellcasting ability modifier to any skill check you make. If you choose to enhance an ally, they can add the same bonus to their skill checks within a 30-foot radius around you.
Roll Reversal: Once during the duration, you can force a creature you can see within 30 feet of you to reroll a skill check they just made, taking the lower of the two results.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can increase the bonus by 1 for each slot level above 5th. You can also target one additional creature to benefit from the skill boost effect for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Skip
entries: You create a temporary skipgate that allows you to teleport a short distance. As a bonus action, you can choose a point within 30 feet that you can see and instantaneously teleport to that location. You can move through the skipgate and reappear at the chosen destination, avoiding opportunity attacks as you move.

Additionally, if you target an object that is no more than 10 pounds and within range, you can teleport it to your current location. This spell can be used to quickly reposition yourself in combat or to grab an item from a distance.

spell.name: Skipdoor
entries: You create a temporary skipgate that acts as a door between two points in space. You can designate two locations within 30 feet of each other to create the skipdoor, allowing anyone to step through and instantly travel between the two spaces.

The skipdoor remains open for the duration of the spell, allowing any number of creatures to pass through. Creatures may use their movement to enter and exit the skipdoor, effectively shortening travel time between the two locations.

If the skipdoor is closed or destroyed before the spell's duration ends, it leaves behind a lingering echo of energy, causing a burst of psychic noise. Each creature within 10 feet of the skipdoor must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and are pushed 10 feet away from the door.
Once the spell ends, the skipdoor collapses, leaving no trace behind, and the two locations remain permanently linked only in memory.

spell.name: Skipshield
entries: You create a shimmering barrier around yourself that absorbs incoming damage and deflects it back to attackers. This shield grants you temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Damage Reflection: Any time you are hit by a melee attack while the shield is active, the attacker takes psychic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
If the temporary hit points are reduced to 0, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Smokepop
entries: You create a dense, swirling cloud of smoke at a point you can see within range. The area within a 20-foot radius becomes heavily obscured, creating an environment where visibility is severely limited. The smoke lasts for the duration or until a strong wind disperses it.

All creatures within the area of effect must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn. On a failed save, they take {@damage 2d6} poison damage and are {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not {@condition poisoned}.

While in the smoke, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls and cannot see beyond 5 feet. Additionally, you can choose to teleport to any unoccupied space within the area of the smoke as a bonus action on your turn, allowing you to reposition yourself strategically.

spell.name: Snap Freeze
entries: You unleash a sudden wave of freezing energy that can target a creature or a small area. Choose one of the following options:
Targeted Freeze:
You target a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.
On a failed save: The target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.
On a successful save: The target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}.
Area Freeze:
You create a freezing blast in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save: A creature takes {@damage 3d10} cold damage and has its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.
On a successful save: A creature takes half damage and suffers no movement penalties.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd for the Targeted Freeze option or increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd for the Area Freeze option.

spell.name: Solar Pinhole
entries: You create a microscopic skipgate linked to the core of a nearby star, allowing a small but constant leak of solar material into the surrounding area. This radiant energy illuminates the space around you, casting bright light that lasts for several days. The warmth provided is sufficient to keep the area comfortable, but not enough to support plant growth. While active, this spell illuminates a 20-foot radius and provides light equivalent to daylight. The skipgate closes after the duration ends, cutting off the flow of solar energy.

spell.name: Spawn Ocular Originator

components.m: (an eye of a beholder or similar creature)

entries: You conjure a powerful ocular entity known as the Ocular Originator, a grotesque being with multiple eyes that gazes upon the battlefield. This creature serves as a beacon of madness and chaos, instilling fear and confusion in your enemies.

Hypnotic Gaze: As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the Ocular Originator to use its Hypnotic Gaze ability. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition charmed} until the end of their next turn. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
Side Effects:

The mental strain of summoning such an entity can be taxing. After the spell ends, you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you take psychic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier and have disadvantage on your next attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the Ocular Originator gains an additional 5 hit points for each slot level above 4th, and you can command it to use Hypnotic Gaze as a reaction when an enemy moves within 30 feet of it.

spell.name: Speedboost
entries: You channel your combat prowess to increase your movement speed. Your speed doubles for the duration of the spell, allowing you to reposition quickly in battle.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Spin Cut
entries: The caster performs a swift spin, channeling psychic energy into a circular arc that slices through enemies within a 10-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} slashing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and remains standing. Additionally, any objects in the area that can be damaged by slashing are also affected, cutting through them easily.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the slashing damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Stabilize
entries: You reach out and touch a creature that has 0 hit points. That creature immediately stabilizes, preventing it from dying and becoming {@condition unconscious}. If the creature is dying, it automatically becomes stable and regains 1 hit point.
Additionally, the target cannot be reduced below 1 hit point for the next hour, as you infuse them with a brief surge of life energy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of hit points restored increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Static Aura
entries: Surround yourself with a crackling field of static electricity, creating an aura that disrupts electronics and shocks nearby creatures.

Effect: Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 1d6} electrical damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of its next turn.
Electronics: The aura also disrupts electronic devices within the same range, causing them to malfunction or become temporarily disabled for the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Static Pulse
entries: Unleash a powerful pulse of electrical energy in a targeted area, causing a surge of static that disrupts both electronics and living creatures.

Effect: Choose a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}.
Electronics: All electronic devices in the area of effect are disabled for 1 minute or until repaired.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Steal Vitality
entries: You siphon the life force from a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you regain no hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Steel Construct

components.m: (a small piece of metal and a gear)

entries: You create a medium-sized construct made of steel that obeys your commands. The construct has an AC of 15 and hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier times 5. It can take actions as you direct it on your turn, and it can make one melee attack (using your spellcasting modifier for attack rolls) against a target within 5 feet, dealing {@damage 2d8} slashing damage.
The construct has a speed of 30 feet and can move through difficult terrain without expending extra movement. It can also be ordered to take the Dash, Disengage, or Help actions on your turn.
If the construct is reduced to 0 hit points, it crumbles into pieces.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create an additional construct for each slot level above 3rd, provided that you can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on them.

spell.name: Strengthen Insect
entries: You infuse a single insect with enhanced vitality and strength. Choose one insect that you can see within range. That insect gains the following benefits for the duration:
Increased Hit Points: The insect's maximum hit points increase by 10.
Damage Resistance: The insect gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Enhanced Attacks: The insect's attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type as its natural attack.
Advantage on Strength Checks: The insect has advantage on all Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional insect for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Stun
entries: You target one creature within range, temporarily disrupting its motor functions with a surge of psychic energy. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier).
On a failed save: The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn.
On a successful save: The target suffers no effects.
Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, they have disadvantage on the saving throw, and their paralysis lasts until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
2nd level: The duration of paralysis increases to 2 turns, but the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
3rd level: You can target one additional creature within 30 feet of the original target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Summon Black Queen

components.m: (a vial of royal jelly and a piece of black hive material)

entries: You summon the Black Queen, a powerful and sentient leader of the Black Hive. The area around you darkens as the air vibrates with the low hum of swarming insects. The Black Queen appears in a cloud of shimmering black and gold energy, radiating authority and control.
Effects:
Ally Summon: The Black Queen appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. She acts as your ally and can follow your commands.

Insectoid Summoning: As part of her arrival, the Black Queen summons a swarm of insectoid allies (such as Black Scarabs or Black Spiders) equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1). These allies remain for the duration of the spell or until they drop to 0 hit points.

Hive Command: While the Black Queen is present, you and your allies can communicate telepathically with her, gaining her tactical insights. Your allies receive advantage on attack rolls against creatures within 10 feet of the Black Queen.
Royal Decree: Once per turn, the Black Queen can issue a command to an allied insectoid creature within 30 feet. That creature can use its reaction to make one attack or move up to its speed.

Aura of Fear: Enemies within 10 feet of the Black Queen must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw at the start of their turn. On a failed save, they are {@condition frightened} until the end of their turn.

spell.name: Summon Black Scarab
entries: Description:

You summon a black scarab that appears in an unoccupied space within range. This scarab acts as your ally and obeys your verbal commands. It has the statistics of a Giant Fire Beetle but deals poison damage instead of fire damage. On its turn, it can move up to 30 feet and make a melee attack against a creature within reach.

When the scarab is summoned, it immediately targets the nearest enemy within range. The scarab lasts for the duration or until it drops to 0 hit points. If cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can summon one additional scarab for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Summon Black Spider
entries: You summon a large black spider, a stealthy and venomous creature, to aid you in battle. The spider appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range.
While the black spider is summoned, it acts on your initiative and follows your commands. If it drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving no physical trace.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can summon one additional black spider for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Summon Black Spledopede
entries: Description:
You summon a black spledopede, a large, aggressive insectoid creature, to fight alongside you. The creature appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range.
While the black spledopede is summoned, it acts on your initiative and follows your commands. If it drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving no physical trace.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can summon one additional black spledopede for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Summon Eyeling
entries: You conjure a small, grotesque creature known as an Eyeling, a twisted aberration with multiple eyes that can scout the area and relay information back to you.
Side Effects:

Casting this spell has a small chance of driving the caster closer to madness. At the end of each hour that the Eyeling is active, the caster must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of madness.

spell.name: Summon Eyeling Horde

components.m: (a small glass eye and a drop of your blood)

entries: You summon a horde of small, grotesque eyeling creatures that swarm around a designated area. These eyeling creatures are known for their unsettling appearance and erratic movements, creating a psychological disturbance in those nearby.

Horde of Eyes: The eyeling horde fills a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The area is considered difficult terrain for enemies. The eyeling horde has a total of 10 hit points and can be attacked as a single creature. When the horde is defeated, it disperses into a cloud of floating eyes, making it difficult for enemies to see clearly.

Disorienting Gaze: Any creature that starts its turn within the horde's area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. Creatures that succeed on the save are immune to this effect for the duration of the spell.
Side Effects:

The horde's presence amplifies your connection to madness. At the end of the spell's duration, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1-2, you suffer a momentary lapse in sanity, giving you disadvantage on your next attack roll or saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of eyeling creatures increases by 5 for each slot level above 3rd, and the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet.

spell.name: Summon Hive Entrance

components.m: (a drop of honeycomb and a piece of black hive material)

entries: You create a temporary portal that leads directly to the Black Hive, the heart of your insectoid allies. This entrance is a swirling mass of black and gold energy, resembling the texture and appearance of honeycomb, which pulsates with a faint hum.
Effects:

Entry for Insectoids: You can summon any number of insectoid allies from the Black Hive to emerge through this entrance. These creatures can include Black Scarabs, Black Spiders, and other engineered insectoid entities of your choice.
Summoning Duration: The summoned creatures remain for up to 1 hour, or until they drop to 0 hit points. After the duration expires, they return to the hive through the entrance.
Defensive Barrier: The entrance generates a faint protective aura, granting a +2 bonus to AC for any allied creatures within 10 feet of it.
Hive Resonance: As long as the entrance remains active, you and your allies can communicate with any creature from the Black Hive telepathically, provided they are within 60 feet.
Actions:

Insectoid Summon: As an action on your turn, you can choose one insectoid creature from the Black Hive to summon through the entrance. The creature appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the entrance.

Hive Defense: Once per round, if any enemy creature enters a 10-foot radius around the entrance, you can direct a swarm of lesser insects to attack them. This is a melee attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can summon one additional type of insectoid creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Summon Mammoth Hive
entries: You summon a colossal mammoth worm, a massive, serpentine creature known for its immense size and ferocity. The worm appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range.
While the mammoth worm is summoned, it acts on your initiative and follows your commands. If it drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving no physical trace.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can summon one additional mammoth worm for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Summon Pack

components.m: (a small token representing each type of animal you wish to summon)

entries: You call upon the spirits of the wilderness to summon a pack of fierce and loyal animals to fight alongside you. Upon casting this spell, you can summon a group of {@dice 1d4 + 2} animals of the same type that are native to the area. Options include wolves, bears, big cats, or other similar creatures, determined by the DM.
Effects:

Pack Tactics: The summoned animals are imbued with a fierce bond and instinct to work together, granting them advantage on attack rolls against any target that one of the pack members has attacked during the same turn.

Coordinated Assault: The summoned animals act on your initiative count and can take their actions to attack or use special abilities. You can command them to focus on a single target or spread their attacks among multiple foes.
Shared Resilience: While the animals are within 30 feet of you, they gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of their turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, you can summon an additional {@dice 1d4} animals for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Time Reversal

components.m: (a piece of the caster’s own hair or nail)

entries: You siphon the life force from a target, causing a reversal of age effects. Choose one creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save:
The target is de-aged by 10 years, removing any age-related penalties (e.g., disadvantage on ability checks or attack rolls due to old age).
The caster ages by 5 years as a result of this siphoning. This aging cannot be undone by any means other than time itself or powerful magic (DM discretion).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher psionic slot:
The amount the target is de-aged increases by 2 years for each slot level above 4th (to a maximum of 20 years).
The aging effect on the caster is reduced by 1 year for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Time Sphere
entries: You create a localized distortion in the flow of time, affecting everything within a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range.

Living Creatures: Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, creatures are rapidly aged by {@dice 1d6} years, suffering the effects of aging, including any penalties due to old age (e.g., disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws).

Plants: All plant life within the area flourishes and withers in an accelerated cycle. Any non-magical plants grow to maturity and then die within the duration. Magical plants may be affected as determined by the DM.

Structures: Non-magical structures within the area begin to disintegrate, suffering a cumulative {@damage 2d6} damage at the start of each of your turns while the spell persists. Magical structures may resist the effects based on the DM's discretion.
End of Duration:

At the end of the spell’s duration, all creatures aged by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they suffer effects equivalent to the penalties of aging (as determined by the DM).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th-level or higher psionic slot:
Increase the radius of the sphere by 10 feet for each slot level above 4th.
The damage to structures increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Timequake

components.m: (a crystal representing the flow of time)

entries: You find a discontinuity in the psychic field and compress it, unleashing a massive temporal disturbance in a 60-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range.
Safe Inner Circle: A 20-foot radius sphere centered on the caster remains unaffected, protecting the caster and any allies within this area from the effects.
Creatures Outside the Safe Circle: Every creature within the affected area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save:

Creatures experience rapid aging equal to {@dice 2d10} years. The DM will determine the effects of aging based on the target’s original age and the severity of the aging (e.g., penalties for being old).
On a successful save, they age {@dice 1d6} years and suffer no penalties.
Structures: All non-magical structures within the area warp and suffer {@damage 3d10} damage, with magical structures potentially resisting based on the DM's discretion.
Aftereffects:
Psychic Coma: After casting, the caster falls into a psychic coma for 1 day (24 hours), becoming {@condition unconscious} and vulnerable during this time.

Timequake Echoes: The echoes of the timequake cause minor psychic pain to every creature within 1 kilometer of the area. Affected creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they suffer {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next saving throw they make. On a success, they take half damage and suffer no additional effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level or higher psionic slot:
The aging effect for failed saves increases by {@dice 1d10} years for each slot level above 5th.
The damage to structures increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Timeskip Meditation
entries: You enter a state of deep meditation, compressing years of experience into a fleeting moment. Upon completing the meditation:
All your expended spell slots are restored (up to 4th-level slots).
You gain proficiency in one skill or tool of your choice for the rest of the session.
You biologically age by 5 years, with all the physical and mental consequences this may bring (as determined by the DM).
Risk of Aging:
If you cast this spell multiple times in rapid succession (within a day or two, subject to DM discretion), your body might suffer cumulative strain, resulting in:
{@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} (1 level per additional cast).
Long-term penalties or illnesses due to accelerated aging.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
2nd-level slot: You restore all expended slots up to 5th-level slots and gain an additional skill proficiency.

spell.name: Transmutation

components.m: (a small piece of the material you wish to transmute)

entries: You can alter the physical properties of a non-magical object within range, transforming it into another type of matter. Choose one of the following effects:

Change Material: You can change the material of a non-magical object to any other non-magical material of your choice (e.g., wood to stone, metal to glass). The object must be no larger than 10 cubic feet. The new material retains the original shape of the object. The object regains its original material after the spell ends.

Change Size: You can alter the size of an object within range. You can either double or halve its dimensions. If the object is alive, it must make a Constitution saving throw; on a failure, it is affected by the size change. The object's weight changes accordingly, but it retains its basic properties.

Elemental Infusion: You can infuse a non-magical object with elemental properties. Choose one damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. The object will deal damage of that type on a successful attack or when it is struck.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect an additional object for each slot level above 4th, up to a maximum of three objects.

spell.name: Transmute Stone
entries: You designate a volume of stone up to 10 cubic feet within range. The minerals within that stone are replaced with a single, randomized type from an underground strata of your choosing (as determined by the DM). This can include precious gems, metals, or other materials, depending on what’s available in your campaign setting.
Potential Randomized Effects: The exact type of stone or mineral replaced should be rolled or selected randomly by the DM (e.g., mithral, adamantine, granite, etc.).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the volume of stone you can affect increases by 10 cubic feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tree Sprout
entries: You tap into the natural energy of the land to summon the rapid growth of a tree. Choose a point within range; a small tree sprouts instantly, reaching a height of 10 feet and occupying a 5-foot radius. The tree is considered a large object with AC 15 and 20 hit points. It can be used for cover, and creatures can climb it using an Athletics check (DC 10).
While the tree is active, it provides additional benefits:
Creatures within 10 feet of the tree have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
You can use your bonus action to command the tree to create a 10-foot radius area of difficult terrain around it, which lasts until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, you can summon one additional tree for each spell slot level above 3rd, placing them up to 30 feet apart.

spell.name: Venom Spit
entries: You launch a glob of corrosive venom at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage, and they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. If cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vortex
entries: You create a swirling vortex of electrical energy in a location of your choice within range.
Effect: Choose a point within range. A 10-foot-radius sphere of swirling electricity forms, creating difficult terrain for creatures within it.

Each creature that starts its turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the center of the vortex. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed.
Any ranged attacks that pass through the vortex are made at disadvantage due to the chaotic energy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wall Raise
entries: You conjure a sturdy wall of material (stone, ice, or other natural elements) that rises from the ground in a location you can see within range. The wall can be up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You choose the wall's orientation and shape, which can be straight, curved, or angled.

The wall provides cover, blocking line of sight and preventing movement through the area it occupies. It has an AC of 15 and hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier × 10. When the wall is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses and disintegrates.

Additionally, you can choose to imbue the wall with a specific elemental effect (such as fire or ice) upon casting. Creatures that attempt to pass through the wall take {@damage 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed Dexterity saving throw, or half as much on a successful save.
You can choose to dismiss the wall as a bonus action, causing it to crumble and return to the earth.

spell.name: Waterskip
entries: You create a temporary skipgate that allows water to flow instantaneously from one location to another. Choose a source of water within range, and specify a destination within 30 feet. The water streams through the skipgate, appearing as a shimmering vortex of liquid, and fills the designated area. The volume of water is equivalent to a small bucket (about 5 gallons). The water can be used to extinguish fires, create barriers, or provide hydration, but it dissipates if not contained within a vessel or the surrounding terrain.

spell.name: Web Slinging
entries: Creates a sticky web-like tether between the caster and a designated point within range. The target can use the tether to swing or pull themselves toward that point, allowing for rapid movement across obstacles. This grants advantage on Acrobatics checks for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast at higher levels, the range increases by 10 feet for each spell level above 2nd.

spell.name: Word Of Alliance
entries: You speak compelling words to a creature within range, fostering a sense of camaraderie and trust. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target:
Considers you a trusted ally.
Is more receptive to your suggestions and can’t take hostile actions against you.
Has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
The charm effect ends if you or your allies harm the target.
Willing Listener: If the target is willing to listen (such as a friend or ally), they can choose to succeed on the saving throw.
Psychic Sensitivity: If the target is psychically sensitive, the duration increases to 10 minutes, and they have disadvantage on the initial saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher-level psionic slot:
4th level: You can target one additional creature within range.
5th level: The duration increases to 10 minutes, and affected creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier at the start of their turn while {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Word Of Animals
entries: You speak a brief phrase that resonates with the innate instincts of nearby animals, allowing you to communicate simple ideas and emotions. Choose a number of creatures equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of one) within range.

The targeted animals understand your meaning and can respond with basic thoughts or actions as determined by their nature. They may feel compelled to assist you, retreat, or avoid conflict, depending on your message and their instincts.

While this spell is active, you can use your bonus action on subsequent turns to command the affected animals to take simple actions (such as moving toward a location, guarding a space, or fleeing). They will not perform complex tasks or risk their lives unnecessarily, but will follow your direction to the best of their abilities.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If cast at higher levels, the number of animals you can affect increases by one for each spell slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Word Of Fear
entries: You utter a word of dread that chills the hearts of your enemies. Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for the duration. A {@condition frightened} target must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Word Of Foretelling
entries: By channeling prophetic whispers from beyond time, you instill a sense of destiny and foreknowledge in those around you. Choose up to three creatures within range (they must be either friendly, neutral, or {@condition restrained}). Depending on the creature’s disposition, they are affected as follows:
Friendly creatures: They gain inspiration (a {@dice d6} they can add to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw within the next hour).
Neutral creatures: They feel the pull of future events and improve their attitude toward you, moving one step closer on the relationship scale (e.g., from indifferent to friendly).
Prisoners/{@condition Restrained|XPHB} creatures: They receive psychic suggestions that weaken their willpower. Their resistance to persuasion or recruitment efforts is reduced by 5.

Hostile creatures: They feel a creeping sense of doom. If they fail a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier), they become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute and cannot willingly move closer to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a psionic slot of 2nd level or higher:
The inspiration die for friendly creatures increases to a {@dice d8}.
You can target two additional creatures per level above 1st.

spell.name: Word Of Healing
entries: You speak a soothing word imbued with restorative energy. Choose one creature you can see within range. That creature regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Word Of Immunity
entries: You speak a powerful word of protection to a willing creature within range, granting them immunity to one type of damage of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. The target is shielded from harm by this specific type of damage for the duration.
